Description:
The FHIR DocumentReference resource describes information about a document. The search interaction enables the client to query for clinical note records based on a patient and optionally created date, document type, status, or encounter ID.

The user must also have security

class.Name: class
class.Description:
Refine a search for DocumentReference resources by category. Only the following values are supported:

  • clinical-note
  • clinical-notes
    • This value does not follow the specification and is supported only for backward compatibility.
class.Optional: Optional starting in Epic version February 2022 or in Epic version November 2021 with special updates. Either “class” or “type” must be specified in earlier versions of Epic.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The encounter that holds the note.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The Patient FHIR ID for whom the clinical note was written.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

period.Name: period
period.Description: The date of service being documented.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The Patient FHIR ID for whom the clinical note was written.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The note category ID or the LOINC code for the document type.

  • code= By default, we support the following LOINC codes for document type. Epic organizations can support additional LOINC codes beyond these defaults with custom mapping.
    • Discharge Documentation (18842-5)
    • Consultation (11488-4)
    • History & Physical (34117-2)
    • Progress Note (11506-3)
    • Procedure Note (28570-0)
    • Emergency Department Note (34111-5)
    • Nurse Note (34746-8)

Starting in the May 2022 version of Epic or the February 2022 version of Epic by special update:

    • Discharge Instructions (74213-0)
    • Risk assessment and screening note (75492-9)

Note category IDs can also be specified, and correspond to note types in Epic.
The format for using Note category IDs is:
type=system|code, where:
system="1.2.840.114350.1.13.[environment identifier].[environment_type].7.4.737880.5010"
code=the note category ID
"environment identifier" is different per epic instance and should be determined at time of implementation. For the App Orchard sandbox it is '0'
"environment type" is '2' for a production instance, '3' for a non-production instance, and '1' for the App Orchard sandbox. For example, in the App Orchard sandbox, if searching for Progress Notes:
type=1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010|1
type.Optional: Optional starting in Epic version February 2022 or in Epic version November 2021 with special updates. Either “class” or “type” must be specified in earlier versions of Epic.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single entry in the resource bundle.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

DocumentReference.Name: DocumentReference
DocumentReference.Description: An instance of the STU3 DocumentReference resource.

authenticator.Name: authenticator
authenticator.Description: Who or what authenticated the document.

author.Name: author
author.Description: Who or what authored the document.

class.Name: class
class.Description:
The category for the resource. Only the following values are supported:
  • clinical-note
  • clinical-notes
    • This value does not follow the specification and is supported only for backward compatibility.

contentType.Name: contentType
contentType.Description: Media type of the resource. This is always "text/html" for clinical notes.

url.Name: url
url.Description: The URI where the data can be found. A reference to the Binary resource which contains the document content.

context.Name: context
context.Description: The context of the document content.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to an Encounter resource as the context of the document content.

period.Name: period
period.Description: This is the time of the service that is being documented.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: The note identifier from the Epic system.

indexed.Name: indexed
indexed.Description: When this document reference was created, which is the same as Created time for notes.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The Patient FHIR ID for whom the clinical note was written.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The note type.

Can be in the format:

  • code= Note Type value from category list
  • system=customer-specific oid for category list

For example:"urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.0.1.7.4.737880.5010"

Otherwise, can be mapped using a core set of the Epic-released category values to LOINC codes:

  • code="10164-2"
  • system="https://loinc.org/"

total.Name: total
total.Description: Total resources that match the search criteria.
